item.title: Wolveseatdogs add a quote by Horace Walpole
item.description: "Imagination was given to man to compensate him for what he isn't. A sense of humor was provided to console him for what he is." -- Horace Walpole

item.title: Wolveseatdogs add a quote by Horace Walpole
item.description: "The world is a tragedy to those who feel, but a comedy to those who think." -- Horace Walpole

item.title: Wolveseatdogs add a quote by Francis Bacon
item.description: "Read not to contradict and confute; nor to believe and take for granted; nor to find talk and discourse; but to weigh and consider. Some books are to be tasted, others to be swallowed, and some few to be chewed and digested: that is, some books are to be read only in parts, others to be read, but not curiously, and some few to be read wholly, and with diligence and attention." -- Francis Bacon

item.title: Wolveseatdogs add a quote by Charlotte Bronte
item.description: "Happiness quite unshared can scarcely be called happiness; it has no taste." -- Charlotte Bronte
